fields.name: rand
fields.value: Generates 9 random digits rather than fetching your timestamp

fields.name: --channel=`ChannelResolvable`
fields.value:
The channel to attach the message collecter to
Default: random text channel

fields.name: --time=`number(m|s)`
fields.value:
How long to collect messages for; Specify minutes or seconds
Default: `1m`

fields.name: new --width=`number` --height=`number`
fields.value:
Create a new board
shorthand = n
Defaults: width = `7`, height = `6`

fields.name: join --marker=`string`
fields.value:
Join the active game
shorthand = j
Can shorthand marker expression
Default: marker = random circle emoji

fields.name: place --col=`number`
fields.value:
During your turn, drops your peice on the board at the specified spot
shorthand = p
Can shorthand column as expression

fields.name: list
fields.value: List the players, the turn order, and their marker

fields.name: kick --player=`GuildMemberResolvable`
fields.value:
Unconditionally remove the given player from the game
Can shorthand player as expression
`GuildMemberResolvable` is an ID, name, or nickname

fields.name: reset
fields.value: Unconditionally resets the game and players

fields.name: list
fields.value:
Display all custom commands
Commands in `lib/` have been committed

fields.name: show <command name>
fields.value:
Display the source code of the specified command
<command name> = text

fields.name: new <command name>
fields.value:
Creates a new command named after the given name. New commands are initialized with a template
<command name> = text

fields.name: commit <command name>
fields.value:
Loads the given command into Bean-Stalk
<command name> = text

fields.name: edit <command name> <sed expression>
fields.value:
Run a [GNU sed](https://www.gnu.org/software/sed) script on the specified command
<command name> = text
<sed expression> = text
Example <sed expression> = s/"foo"/"bar"/g

fields.name: append <command name> <?line number> <code>
fields.value:
Appends <code> to the end of the specified command; Optionally at <?line number>
<command name> = text
<?line number> = number
<code> = javascript code
Defaults: <?line number> = EOF-1

fields.name: upload <command name>
fields.value: not implemented

fields.name: disable <command name>
fields.value: not implemented

fields.name: enable <command name>
fields.value: not implemented

fields.name: `number` --count=`number`
fields.value:
That's right, you use the dice size as the subcommand here. Use count to roll multiple dice at once
Can shorthand count as expression
Default: count = `1`

fields.name: history
fields.value:
Prints the last 16 rolls
shorthand = hist

fields.name: proof
fields.value: Attaches the dice rolling algorithm to silence those who oppose Bean-Stalk

fields.name: load
fields.value: Loads your character's object to use the next subcommands

fields.name: check <stat>
fields.value:
Rolls a d20 check against the given stat
<stat> = text
Options: <stat> = con, str, dex, wis, int

fields.name: save <stat>
fields.value:
Rolls a d20 saving throw against the given stat
<stat> = text
Options: <stat> = con, str, dex, wis, int

fields.name: show <?what>
fields.value:
Prints your character's meta data
<?what> = text
Options: <?what> = stats, proficiencies, inventory
Defaults <?what> = null

fields.name: create --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM` --location=`ChannelResolvable` --attendees=`list<GuildMemberResolvable>` --roles=`list<GuildRoleResolvable>` --period=`number` --description=`string` -raw -silent --command=`string`
fields.value:
creates a new event with the given variables
-raw = only output event description
-silent = don't event details
The list variables are space seperated, so you'll need to double quote them if your adding multiple users/roles

fields.name: join --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM`
fields.value: join the specified event

fields.name: show --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM`
fields.value: display the specified event

fields.name: list
fields.value: Lists all events

fields.name: edit --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM` `variable/flag`=`new value`
fields.value:
edit the field of the specified event
note: to change the name and time, use newtime and newname as the change variables

fields.name: leave --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM`
fields.value: voluntarily exile yourself from the specified event

fields.name: kick --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM` --attendee=`GuildMemberResolvable`
fields.value: forcably remove the given attendee from the specified event. Only an event mod can do this

fields.name: mod --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM` --attendee=`GuildMemberResolvable`
fields.value: Give a user admin/mod permissions. Only an event mod can do this

fields.name: delete --name=`string` --time=`HH:MM`
fields.value: Remove the specified event. Only an event mod can do this

fields.name: `string`
fields.value:
convert the given message to Grant Speak
Default: if no string is provided, tries to use the message before the command

fields.name: `javascriptCode`
fields.value: The javascript to execute. stdout is slowly printed to the message channel as it recieves it. Process will be manually killed if it takes too long

fields.name: `lineNumber`
fields.value:
Fetch the specified line number
Default: random line number in file

fields.name: reload `commandName`
fields.value: Transpile and reload the specified command or all commands if none specified

fields.name: die
fields.value: Log out and kill Bean-Stalk's process

fields.name: commands
fields.value: List all available commands

fields.name: uptime
fields.value: Display Bean's uptime

fields.name: regex -on
fields.value:
Turn regex and timestamp reactions on or off
-on = if supplied in command, turns regex responses on
Default: off

fields.name: vrms
fields.value: List all non-free packages installed on Bean-Stalk's OS

fields.name: screenfetch
fields.value: Display Bean-Stalk meta data

fields.name: new `playerMarker`
fields.value:
Create a new board
shorthand subcommand = n
Defaults: `playerMarker` = :joy:

fields.name: move `direction`
fields.value:
Move your player in the specified direction
shorthand subcommand = m
`direction` = up, down, left, right, u, d, l, r

fields.name: shoot `direction`
fields.value:
Shoot your bow in the specified direction
shorthand subcommand = s
`direction` = up, down, left, right, u, d, l, r
